title: Menopause: I thought I had a brain tumour - Davina McCall
content: This video can not be playedTV presenter Davina McCall has told the BBC how she thought she had a brain tumour or Alzheimer's when suffering from perimenopausal symptoms.She added that it was a "sad state of affairs" that women struggled to get the medical help they need from some GPs.Davina McCall: Sex, Mind and the Menopause airs on Channel 4 on Monday 2nd May at 9pm.
